ns0:model.name: mango
ns0:model.description: The purpose of MANGO, which stands for MO-del for AN-notating G-eneric O-objects, is to add an upper level of description to the tabular data of query responses. It allows metadata to be extended, complex quantities to be reconstructed from column values, and properties to be linked. It also allows to specify the origin af the data.
ns0:model.title: Mango
ns0:model.author: Laurent Michel, Fran??ois Bonnarel, Gilles Landais, Mireille Louys, Marco Molinaro, Jesue Salgado

enumeration.name: ShapeFrame
enumeration.description: Possible schemes to encode a shape in a string

enumeration.name: ShapeSerialization
enumeration.description: Enumeration of the supported serialization modes for the shapes

literal.name: MOC
literal.description: Label indicating that the shape has been serialized as a S-MOC

literal.name: STCS
literal.description: Label indicating that the shape has been serialized as a STC-S \citep{2007ivoa.spec.1030R} string

literal.name: POLYGON
literal.description: Label indicating that the shape has been serialized as a polygon (cf xtypes)

enumeration.name: CalibrationLevel
enumeration.description: Enumeration of different possible calibration status of the property as defined in Obscore

literal.name: Raw
literal.description: Raw instrumental data, in a proprietary or internal data provider defined format, that needs instrument specific tools to be handled (ObsCore)

literal.name: Instrumental
literal.description: Instrumental data in a standard format which could be manipulated with standard astronomical packages (ObsCore).

literal.name: Calibrated
literal.description: Science ready data with the instrument signature removed (ObsCore)

enumeration.name: ColorDefinition
enumeration.description: Enumeration of the different types of colors supported by the model.

literal.name: HardnessRatio
literal.description: Normalized ratio of fluxes: $(F_{EB2} - F_{EB1}) / (F_{EB2} + F_{EB1})$

dataType.name: VocabularyTerm
dataType.description: Class holder for a term of a standardized vocabulary that applies to a property.

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: URI the vocabulary term

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Label attached to the vocabulary term. This is necessary because the URI may not contain any explicit label. This was the case for the IUA vocabulary until the Registry WG introduced rewriting rules that fix the issue.

objectType.name: MangoObject
objectType.description: Central model class: applied to a data table, each row can be modelled as a \texttt{MangoObject} instance. Each \texttt{MangoObject} hosts a collection of physical or calculated parameters, a description of the data origin and an identifier.

attribute.name: identifier
attribute.description: Unique identifier of the \texttt{MangoObject}. The uniqueness of that identifier is not managed by the model. The format is free.

composition.name: propertyDock
composition.description: Reference to the open-ended collection of the \texttt{MangoObject} properties (physical or calculated).

reference.name: dataOrigin
reference.description: Reference to the description of the origin of the \texttt{MangoObject}.

reference.name: associatedMangoObjects
reference.description: Abstract reference to a particular dataset associated to the MANGO entity. This class is used to specify the type of the associated dataset as well as its role.

objectType.name: DataLink
objectType.description: This property describes static links pointing to some external data. This allows services that do not implement DataLink services to expose linked data as flattened DataLink (1.1) responses.

attribute.name: content_type
attribute.description: mime type of the content the link returns (see DataLink 1.1)

attribute.name: access_url
attribute.description: contains an URL for downloading a single resource. There is no restriction on the type of resource accessed by the links.

attribute.name: content_qualifier
attribute.description: Gives the nature of the thing or service that is returned by the link. The value is always interpreted as a URI. If the access_url references a data product, the content_qualifier field should define its product type . In this case the content qualifier value always starts with a hash completing the \url{http://www.ivoa.net/rdf/datalink/product-type} base URI. For \texttt{MangoObject} not linking to data products, content_qualifier’s interpretation will be different, and the default vocabulary will be inappropriate. Full concept URIs will have to be used in this case. (DataLink 1.1)

attribute.name: local_semantics
attribute.description: Allows for identification of corresponding rows for different IDs in the same DataLink service where the combination of semantics, content_type and content_qualifier is not sufficient to identify them (see DataLink 1.1).

objectType.name: AssociatedMangoObject
objectType.description: This class gives the role of a link associating 2 \texttt{MangoObject} together.

attribute.name: semantics
attribute.description: Semantic concept giving the nature of the data association.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Free text description of the data association

objectType.name: Property
objectType.description: Class holder for a particular property, either physical or calculated, of the MANGO object. This class specifies both type and role of the property, and hosts the property instance itself.

attribute.name: semantics
attribute.description:
Reference to a semantic concept giving the nature of the property or of the set made of the property and its associated properties.
The semantics field contains a URI for a concept that describes the meaning of the property. This attribute is intended to be machine-readable and to assist automated link selection, presentation, and usage. The value is always interpreted as a URI; relative URIs (Berners-Lee and Fielding et al., 2005) are completed using the base URI of the core DataLink vocabulary, http://www.ivoa.net/rdf/datalink/core. Terms from this vocabulary must always be written as relative URIs. This means that for concepts from the core vocabulary, the value in the semantics fieldz always starts with a hash. (datalink1.1). The semantic concept apply to a single property or to the set made of the property and its associated properties (e.g. position and flag).

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Free text description of the property or of the set made of the property and its associated properties.

reference.name: associatedProperties
reference.description: Open-ended collection of MANGO properties associated with the \texttt{MangoObject}. These relationships are typically used to associate physical properties with time stamps and/or quality factors.

objectType.name: Status
objectType.description: Property representing a status defined by a integer number that can only take on a defined number of values, each with its own description. Boolean status can be represented by \texttt{StatusValues} with 2 values e.g. 0 for False and 1 for True.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Actual value of the status

composition.name: allowedValues
composition.description: List of the allowed values for the status. Each value has its own free text description.

objectType.name: Label
objectType.description: Free text label seen as a MANGO object property.

attribute.name: text
attribute.description: Text of label property of the MANGO object.

objectType.name: Shape
objectType.description: Description of the spatial extension of the MANGO object (for e.g. dust clouds)

attribute.name: shape
attribute.description: String serialization of the spatial extension of the \texttt{MangoObject}

attribute.name: serialization
attribute.description: Serialization mode of the spatial extension of the MANGO entity

reference.name: spaceSys
reference.description: Coordinate system that applies for the shape

objectType.name: PhotometricProperty
objectType.description: Observed brightness of the \texttt{MangoObject}. The distinction between fluxes and magnitudes is made by the unit. This property should refer to a photometric calibration as defined by the \texttt{Phot} data model (1.1).

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Value of the photometric property associated with a photometric calibration as defined by the \texttt{PhotDM} model.

reference.name: photCal
reference.description: Photometric calibration that applies to the photometric property. It must be an instance of \texttt{photdm:PhotCal}.

objectType.name: PhysicalProperty
objectType.description: Place holder for any quantity that can be hold by measure classes as defined in the \texttt{Astronomical Measurements Model}.

attribute.name: calibrationLevel
attribute.description: Calibration level of the property as defined in ObsCore \citep{2011ivoa.spec.1028T}.

composition.name: measure
composition.description: Instance of \texttt{Astronomical Measurements Model} that holds the Property value(s).

objectType.name: Color
objectType.description: Property that describes a color of the \texttt{MangoObject}. The color is not an intrinsic property of the MANGO object, but a value relative to two filters or energy bands.

composition.name: colorDef
composition.description: Reference to the physical definition of the color (can be either a difference of magnitudes or a hardness ratio).

objectType.name: ColorDef
objectType.description: Physical color definition giving the way a color is calculated (magnitude difference or hardness ratio) and the filters on which the color is based. In case of hardness ratio, the energy bands might be modeled as instances of \texttt{Phot:PhotometryFilter} with a square transfert function.

attribute.name: definition
attribute.description: Attribute giving the way the color is calculated (magnitude difference or hardness ratio).

composition.name: high
composition.description: Reference to the \texttt{Phot:PhotometryFilter} \citep{2022ivoa.spec.1101S} corresponding the higher band of the color.

composition.name: low
composition.description: Reference to the \texttt{Phot:PhotometryFilter} corresponding the lower band for that color.

objectType.name: BitField
objectType.description: Property for which each possible value is represented by a bit, so that multiple states can be contained in the same integer value. The possible values are defined in the associated \texttt{StatusValues}, which must correspond to a bit pattern (each value must be a power of 2). This constraint is not enforced by the model.

objectType.name: StatusValues
objectType.description: Class holder for the list of the allowed values for the status.

composition.name: values
composition.description: List of the allowed values for the status; each value has its own textual description.

objectType.name: StatusValue
objectType.description: Value allowed for a status; contain the value with a free text description.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Allowed value for a \texttt{Status}

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Free text description of the allowed value for a \texttt{Status}

objectType.name: EpochPosition
objectType.description:
This class is a view of \texttt{Astronomical Coordinates and Coordinate Systems} \citep{2022ivoa.specQ1004R} components that have been put together to form a consistent description of the position of an object moving over time. It consists of a celestial position, a proper motion, a radial velocity and a parallax. All components share the same coordinate systems for both time and space coordinates.
\begin{itemize} \item Both position and proper motion reuse \texttt{coords:LonLatPoint} elements. \item The space coordinate system is imported from \texttt{coords:spaceSys}. \item The time coordinate system is imported from \texttt{coords:timeSys}. \end{itemize}
The \texttt{EpochPosition} error is modeled by specific classes supporting covariance and/or correlation between components.
All individual components have their own units which must be consistent to each others. This consistency is not enforced by the model.
Possible correlations between \texttt{EpochPosition} parameters are handle by the \texttt{EpochPositionCorrelation} class.

attribute.name: longitude
attribute.description: The longitude of the Point, as a Quantity with angular units (see \texttt{coords:LonLatPoint.lon}.

attribute.name: latitude
attribute.description: The latitude of the Point, as a Quantity with angular units (see \texttt{coords:LonLatPoint.lat}.

attribute.name: parallax
attribute.description: The measured parallax in the coordinate system of the \texttt{EpochPosition} instance.

attribute.name: radialVelocity
attribute.description: The measured Velocity along of the radius axis (see \texttt{meas:Velocity.coord} in \cite{2022ivoa.spec.1004R}).

attribute.name: pmLongitude
attribute.description: Velocity along the longitude axis in angular distance per unit time (see \texttt{meas:ProperMotion.coord}). The current version of the model only allows a representation in the Polar coordinate space.

attribute.name: pmLatitude
attribute.description: Velocity along the latitude axis in angular distance per unit time (see \texttt{meas:ProperMotion.coord}). The current version of the model only allows a representation in the Polar coordinate space.

attribute.name: epoch
attribute.description: Position epoch expressed within the common time system (see \texttt{coords:epoch})

attribute.name: pmCosLat_applied
attribute.description: It is common, though not universal, practice to quote longitudinal proper motion pre-multiplied by cos(latitude) so that the magnitude of the quantity is not affected by its longitudinal position. We do not constrain the value to one form or the other in this model. Instead, this flag enables providers to convey whether or not the factor has been applied (see \texttt{meas:ProperMotion.cosLat_applied})

composition.name: errors
composition.description: Reference to the combined errors of the \texttt{EpochPosition} components.

composition.name: correlations
composition.description: Reference to the correlations between the \texttt{EpochPosition} components.

reference.name: spaceSys
reference.description: System that applies the space coordinates.

reference.name: timeSys
reference.description: System that applies the time coordinates (the epoch).

objectType.name: EpochPositionErrors
objectType.description: Class holder for the errors of the EpochPosition attributes

composition.name: parallax
composition.description: Parallax error. This error is meant to be symmetrical in the current model version.

composition.name: radialVelocity
composition.description: Error in the radial velocity. This error is meant to be symmetrical in the current model version.

composition.name: position
composition.description: Position error; can be an ellipse, a correlation matrix or a covariance matrix.

composition.name: properMotion
composition.description: Position error; can be an ellipse, a correlation matrix or a covariance matrix.

objectType.name: EpochPositionCorrelations
objectType.description: Class holder for the correlation coefficients between the \texttt{EpochPosition} components.

attribute.name: longitudeParallax
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the position longitude and the parallax

attribute.name: latitudeParallax
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the position latitude and the parallax

attribute.name: pmLongitudeParallax
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the proper motion longitude and the parallax

attribute.name: pmLatitudeParallax
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the proper motion latitude and the parallax

attribute.name: longitudeLatitude
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the position longitude and the position latitude

attribute.name: pmLongitudePmLatitude
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the proper motion longitude and the proper motion latitude

attribute.name: latitudePmLatitude
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the position latitude and the proper motion latitude

attribute.name: latitudePmLongitude
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the position latitude and the proper motion longitude

attribute.name: longitudePmLatitude
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the position longitude and the proper motion latitude

attribute.name: longitudePmLongitude
attribute.description: Correlation (or covariance) coefficient between the position longitude and the proper motion longitude

attribute.name: isCovariance
attribute.description: Boolean telling whether the correlations must be interpreted as covariance or as correlation coefficients.

package.name: error
package.description: The \texttt{error} package groups the MANGO built-in error classes. All these classes are derived from \texttt{meas:Uncertainty} to make them reusable by \texttt{meas:Measure} instances. Mango errors all have an attribute that specifies the confidence level

dataType.name: PropertyError
dataType.description: Root (abstract) class of the errors that can be attached to a MANGO property. The class inherits from \texttt{meas:uncertainty} in order to be usable in the context of properties based on \texttt{Measures} classes.

attribute.name: confidenceLevel
attribute.description: Confidence level of the error. The confidence level must be in $[0, 1]$ (not enforced by the VO-DML schema).

attribute.name: sigma
attribute.description: Magnitude of error on a one-dimensional parameter

dataType.name: ErrorCovMatrix
dataType.description: Covariance matrix for the error of a 2D quantities. The covariance matrix is symmetrical.

attribute.name: variance1
attribute.description: Variance of the first dimension (right ascension in case of sky coordinates)

attribute.name: variance2
attribute.description: Variance of the second dimension (declination in case of sky coordinates)

attribute.name: covariance
attribute.description: Covariance of the 2 axis

dataType.name: Ellipse
dataType.description: Elliptic error for 2D parameters such as sky positions. Major axis and minor axis have their own units, which must be the same for both. This is not enforced by the model.

attribute.name: semiMajorAxis
attribute.description: Half of the ellipse major axis

attribute.name: semiMinorAxis
attribute.description: Half of the ellipse minor axis

attribute.name: angle
attribute.description: Angle between the North Polar Cape (NCP) and the major axis. This angle must be positive taking into account that angles are positive from North to the East. The angle has its own unit.

dataType.name: PropertyError2D
dataType.description: Super (abstract) class for all errors of 2D parameters

dataType.name: ErrorCorrMatrix
dataType.description: Correlation matrix for the error of a 2D quantities. The correlation matrix is symmetrical.

attribute.name: sigma1
attribute.description: Error on the first dimension (right ascension in case of sky coordinates)

attribute.name: sigma2
attribute.description: Error on the second dimension (declination in case of sky coordinates)

attribute.name: correlation
attribute.description: Correlation coefficient between the 2 axis

package.name: dataorigin
package.description: Package grouping together all the components needed to model the origin of \texttt{MangoObject}.

objectType.name: DataOrigin
objectType.description: Class representing the origin of the data following the DCP note

attribute.name: citation
attribute.description: Dataset identifier that can be used for citation (e.g. DOI)

attribute.name: reference_url
attribute.description: Dataset landing page

attribute.name: resource_version
attribute.description: Dataset version

attribute.name: creator
attribute.description: Person(s) mainly involved in the creation of the resource, generally the author

attribute.name: cites
attribute.description: Identifier (IVOID, DOI or Bibcode) of a second Resource using relation of type \texttt{cites} (\url{https://www.ivoa.net/rdf/voresource/relationship_type/})

attribute.name: is_derived_from
attribute.description: Identifier (IVOID, DOI or Bibcode) of a second resource using relation of type \texttt{is_derived_from} (\url{https://www.ivoa.net/rdf/voresource/relationship_type/})

attribute.name: original_date
attribute.description: Date of the original resource from which the MANGO object is derived

reference.name: query
reference.description: Description of the request from which the data originates.

reference.name: rights
reference.description: Reference to the rights that apply to the data.

reference.name: article
reference.description: Reference to the article from which the data originates.

objectType.name: Article
objectType.description: Reference article for the MANGO entity

attribute.name: editor
attribute.description: Name of the article editor

attribute.name: code
attribute.description: Bibcode or DOI of the reference article

objectType.name: QueryOrigin
objectType.description: Description of the query the MANGO instance results from.

attribute.name: ivoid
attribute.description: IVOID of the underlying data collection

attribute.name: publisher
attribute.description: Data center that produced the MANGO instance

attribute.name: server_software
attribute.description: Version of the software the produced the MANGO object instance. It is encouraged to follow \url{https://ivoa.net/documents/Notes/softid/index.html}.

attribute.name: service_protocol
attribute.description: IVOID \citep{2007ivoa.spec.0314P} of the protocol through which the data was retrieved

attribute.name: request
attribute.description: Full request URL including a query string. For the simple protocols,put the url-encoded form of the query parameters. For TAP queries, use the /sync UWS \citep{2016ivoa.spec.1024H} URL. The format is free for others request types.

attribute.name: query
attribute.description: Input query in a formal langage such as ADQL.equest types \citep{2023ivoa.spec.1215M}

attribute.name: request_date
attribute.description: Query execution date

attribute.name: contact
attribute.description: Email or URL to contact the publisher

objectType.name: License
objectType.description: Place holder for the license covering the MANGO instance

attribute.name: rights_uri
attribute.description: Licence URI. Following Registry practice, this should come from SPDX https://spdx.org/licenses/, though Creative Commons URLs https://creativecommons.org are also admitted.

attribute.name: rights
attribute.description: License or Copyright text
